text: hey guys, questions on Tags in galapagos.
if I add a comma delimited list of tags, does it treat them as new items?
or do I need to send you guys a list of new tags
wanted to add Hackathon, IOT, Internet of Things, etc
believe we need to add new tags to the system
ok
yeah it's pulling from a predefined list of tags
the idea was to streamline our tagging system so that sorting by tags could actually be useful
ah, makes sense
we can switch up the list of valid tags easily though
i'll go w/ hardware prototyping and experience design for now, but maybe we should discuss adding new tags consistent with some of the new types of things we might be blogging about (e.g., events, )
Would anyone be able to demo Galapagos to Tim from the Outdoor Project around 5pm today? Grabbing a beer now and it came up.
ooooh outdoor project!
<@U026NB2U2>: I'd be happy to if nobody else can.
I've got a big screen. I can clean up my area a bit too.
i'm trying to finish up some goldmember stuff this afternoon, so <@U026PLK4S> that'd be awesome
cms, correct? like how it works?
Also, as a side note, would love to chat later about dedicating some time to work on Galapagos UX/dev polish. I know <@U0260V1BX> had some great thoughts on this.
Nevermind! Did it on my phone.
haha
yes, ewald and i had talked about making it an actual project at some point
i still very much want to do that
moreso now that we're doing a site refresh
totaly
Yes. Happy to help in any way I can. Also need an excuse to get my hands dirty with the CMS code.
If we're adding things and refactoring, I'd love to be able to go back over the code base myself first
now that i've got another year of angular project experience under my belt
Totally. Would love to shadow you if possible. I've got 0 years of angular experience.
of course. more than anything i'd love to be able to refactor everything so it'll be easiest for anyone to get in there and add/change stuff or clone for a new project
:ok_hand:
